root: ^Don Quixote: It is my turn, I saw your buttons.

c-0: ^Description: You see all the knowledge of modern physics floating around, ready to be crammed into Don Quixote's 17th century brain. All the illusion of his grandiosity will be gone in a mere moment.
^Don Quixote: Whooo what are these weird symbols? Are they a witch's markings? Some kind of ritual?
^Don Quixote: Huhhh... so a feather woudl land at the same time as a stone ball...
^Don Quixote: Ah force reaction, gravity, relativity... nooooo! All my life is a lie!!!
^Don Quixote: Make it stop! Make it stop!
^Description: Don Quixote relaxes after the learning has completed. He seems, different, with much less spirit.
^Don Quixote: I see it all now. My foolish ways. I will devote my life to mathematics now, I hope Sancho is ok with this.
c-1: ^Don Quixote: I'll conquer whatever is out there and come b a   c     k...
